item.title: Carmageddon: Rogue Shift launch patch notes are here, future content detailed
item.content:encoded:
34BigThings has now launched Carmageddon: Rogue Shift, a new take on the Carmageddon formula which sees the new entry become a roguelite racer. With the release of Carmageddon: Rogue Shift, 34BigThings has also detailed the day one patch 0 launch update, as well as provided some updates on what future updates will be contain.

  • Bug fixing and performance improvements to make sure everyone’s first experience is the best it can be
  • Lighting improvements and optimization
  • Collision passes
  • Blood effect and logics rework
  • Improved visuals and geometries of different vehicles
  • Boss vehicles’ trails
  • Final boss attack VFX polish
  • Revamped some tutorials
  • Polished End Run screen
  • Vehicle integrity audio system
  • Sidebash and boost SFX polish
  • Weapons’ SFX polish
  • Cinematic to gameplay transition polish

A couple of unfortunate last-minute regressions may cause:

  • ”Cycle Camera” and “Horn” inputs are inverted in the Controls screen :s
  • Unexpected flickering of the central square of the weapon lock indicator when multiple targets are simultaneously locked
  • Occasional missing HP bar from Piccolo Enforcers and some Special Wasted
  • Occasional flickering shadows.
  • Incorrect proportions of opponent indicators on the minimap on some small screens, eg. the Steam Deck.

In terms of what to expect, 34BigThings has announced the main features that it expects to add in patches one and two. In patch one, the main addition will be a bonnet cam allowing players a more close up view of the action. In patch two, the aim is to add a Challenge mode which will add a variety of modifiers including harder opponents, resource scarcity, deadlier Wasted, and no retries. 34BigThings will also be looking at adding steering wheel support with the release of patch two.

Source: Steam

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 07/02/26
item.content:encoded:
The Six Nations is back, having kicked off on Thursday with a thorough drubbing of Ireland by France. Has that set the narrative for this year’s competition? It was certainly an ominous performance, but we’ll have to see how England host Wales, and Italy host Scotland today to see if anyone feels like they can challenge Les Bleus.

In the News This Week

We had a new Nintendo Direct this week, just as predicted, with a focus on all the third party partners and their games coming to Switch 2 (and Switch) through this year. Here’s that and everything else from the week.

  • All the trailers and announcements from Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase in February 2026
  • Fallout 4 and Indiana Jones get Switch 2 release dates, Oblivion Remastered also confirmed
  • Pragmata and Monster Hunter Stories 3 demos drop onto Switch 2 and other consoles
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is coming to Switch 2 and Xbox Series X|S this June
  • Overwatch 2 is just Overwatch again, with new story arcs and new characters including Jetpack Cat
  • Valve admits RAM and SSD prices are affecting the Steam Machine launch and price
  • The next Xbox could be released next year, says AMD
  • Build a Rocket Boy say they have uncovered a €1 million+ sabotage plot against MindsEye
  • Nintendo Switch 2 passes 17 million, while Switch 1 jumps the DS to become second best-selling console ever
  • Square Enix’s Killer Inn hits Early Access soon with a Free Stay Weekend this week

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Just a handful of scored game reviews this week, but it was another superb soulslike that was the cream of the crop. That and a remade JRPG classic.

  • Nioh 3 – PS5, PC – 9/10
  • Dragon Quest VII Reimagined – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Speedball – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 7/10
  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins – Visions of Four Heroes – DLC – 6/10

We also sent Nic along to BAFTA Games in Concert for its opening night, and he had a lovely time seeing great gaming soundtracks performed live.

I started off the week talking about how World War Z x The Walking Dead blends slower zombies into a fast zombie co-op shooter, before turning my attentions to reporting from a Switch 2 preview event. This included putting my face into the recreated Virtual Boy accessory, savouring the party atmosphere of the new Super Mario Bros. Wonder – Meetup in Bellabel Park DLC, and the wild action of Mario Tennis Fever. I also got to dip a toe into Resident Evil Requiem and Pragmata on Switch 2, to see how they compare to my previous time playing on PS5.

Ade spoke to the Lead Narrative Designer of Titan Quest 2 to explore its take on Greek mythology, while Miguel sat down to chat with Suda51 for his upcoming Romeo is a Dead Man

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Overwatch (still 2), Nioh 3 and Speedball.

Trailer Park

Orbitals looks like a 90s anime It Takes Two, coming exclusively to Switch 2 this summer

Planet of Lana 2 is launching in March, and a demo is coming next week

Paranormasight The Mermaid’s Curse reveals a creepy new island mystery

The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales gets a release date

That’s all for the round up this week. Enjoy the weekend and we’ll carry on carrying on on Monday.

item.title: MIO: Memories In Orbit patch 1.2 is out and addresses some bugs
item.content:encoded:
Developer Douze Dixièmes has released the first major patch for its tough platforming metroidvania MIO: Memories In Orbit, with patch 1.2 addressing bugs and a few balance issues. The aim of the patch according to the development team is to make MIO: Memories In Orbit a smoother and more enjoyable experience. The patch notes do contain a few spoilers so if you don’t want to know anymore, then click away from this page now.

MIO: Memories In Orbit patch 1.2 update notes

  • Fix a bug where the fourth tremor would trigger too early (sorry)
  • Fix a bug where the boss assist (“Eroded Bosses”) would not work on some combination of boss fight and respawn checkpoint
  • Fix HUD logic for the “Hand’s greed” modifier feedback
  • Fix the invisible trapdoor after the Dr Halyn fight
  • Fix invisible ceiling in <redacted>
  • Fix lootable nacre through ceiling in Foundations
  • Fix missing corpse for Calderon after the fight
  • Fix collider/visual mismatch in the shuttle shafts (esp ice section)
  • Fix Capucine’s statue dialogs
  • Small typo fixes in game texts
  • Tweak attack direction selection logic for d-pad & keyboard to help with pogo misses
  • Change the “Hand’s greed” modifier to also use decayed health (tremor) as an additional damage boost source
  • Tweak hitbox behavior for the FRIENDS fight
  • Tune Shii armor during certain animations
  • Apply damage upgrades to scrap pile attacks
  • Tune the ending section of Sawlong to make it slightly less punishing
  • Remove low health feedback during the Khlia sequence
  • Remove some health bars in the Pit
  • Remove the alternate path in the striders tutorial section
  • Change the entrance shortcut of the Chapel to avoid misleading people into not doing the level
  • Change metropolis <redacted> entrance to allow escaping even after sequence break
  • Tweak some respawn zone in Metropolis platforming gauntlets

  • Improve camera handling during the Vlad fight

  • Speed up the Sol&Vin elevator after the first fight attempt
  • Speed up the Shuttles once Dr Halyn has been encountered the first time
  • Shorten input lock on checkpoint after death
  • Tweak a couple background elements that could be confused with walkable platforms in the Haven
  • Tweak the visuals for  the drawer secret passageway in the Vaults
  • <REDACTED> in the credits ❤️
  • Credits update (font list, production babies)

In our MIO: Memories In Orbit review, I said, “MIO: Memories In Orbit is an early contender for one of the most memorable games of 2026. It is an incredibly challenging game to play, with combat being a highlight, even if some platforming section can be frustrating. It looks fantastic, though, and the story is well told. MIO: Memories In Orbit draws you in, and does not let go easily. It is hard game but the journey is worth experiencing.”

Source: Steam
